Description:
ResponsibilitiesProviding trading coverage for either day trading session or night trading session in collaboration with other Shanghai-based traders.
Watching automated trading systems during Asian market hours in a variety of markets across multiple trading teams using in-house custom tools. On a daily basis, this includes initiating, suspending, resuming, and ending trading software by working autonomously and by working with trading advices from software providers.
Performing quantitative analysis.
Monitoring live trading for risk and compliance issues and quickly respond to unusual behaviors or market conditions.
Working with risk and engineering teams to design, write specifications for, and test next-generation automated monitoring systems.
Working with brokers and exchanges to resolve intraday trading issues.
Carefully documenting procedures and log production issues as they occur.Skills
Skills:
A degree in computer science or a related field from a top university
At least 2 years of experience in a trading/support role
Working knowledge of equities, futures, options, and FX markets
Solid experience with automated trading strategies
An understanding of exchange-specific rules and procedures
The ability to manage multiple tasks in a fast-paced environment
Strong problem-solving skills and attention to detail
Experience with SQL, Python, and Linux 
Excellent communication skills and fluency in English for business purposes
